attributes.action: Remove the Home Secretary from the cabinet or retract her comments
attributes.additional_details:
She must be removed from the cabinet or unequivocally apologise for her statements, and retract these statement which will only fuel rejection and hate between communities in the UK.

She labeled people supporting the humane treatment of children and civilians in Gaza as Hamas supporters.

The Home Secretary is trying to stop people in the UK from demonstrating the basic human right of freedom of expression and freedom of peaceful demonstrations.
attributes.background:
The Home Secretary has strong family links and interests in Israel, she is not neutral in her stance to any issues related to Gaza conflict

She has offending many communities in the UK and uses hate speech towards demonstaters.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions that include calls for a Minister to be sacked or removed from office.  

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that. 

For example, you might wish to sign one or both of these petitions:

Remain neutral in Israel-Palestine conflict and withdraw support for Israel
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/648225

Revoke guidance to Chief Constables following Israel-Hamas conflict
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/648469
